title: Russia deems Moscow Times ‘undesirable,’ putting writers, sources at risk
content: The classification forces organizations to cease operations in Russia and opens Russians who work for, fund or collaborate with them to potential prosecution.
summary: The classification forces organizations to cease operations in Russia and opens Russians who work for, fund or collaborate with them to potential prosecution.

title: U.K. police find wanted man after suspected triple murder by crossbow
content: Kyle Clifford, 26, was found by police in Enfield, London, on Wednesday, Hertfordshire police said in a statement.
summary: Kyle Clifford, 26, was found by police in Enfield, London, on Wednesday, Hertfordshire police said in a statement.

title: Ukraine’s first F-16s will see combat this summer, officials say
content: Denmark and the Netherlands have begun to transfer the F-16s they promised to Ukraine, while Belgium and Norway said they would supply others.
summary: Denmark and the Netherlands have begun to transfer the F-16s they promised to Ukraine, while Belgium and Norway said they would supply others.

title: NATO leaders move to ‘Trump-proof’ the alliance in Washington
content: Fears that the former president could soon be back in the White House have NATO leaders looking to lock in support for Ukraine -- and the alliance itself.
summary: Fears that the former president could soon be back in the White House have NATO leaders looking to lock in support for Ukraine -- and the alliance itself.

title: Israel calls for Gaza City to evacuate, affecting hundreds of thousands
content: The Israeli directive comes amid glimmers of hope for a cease-fire as negotiations resume in Qatar.
summary: The Israeli directive comes amid glimmers of hope for a cease-fire as negotiations resume in Qatar.

title: Will the Paris Olympics be the friendliest yet for competing moms?
content: For the first time, the Olympic Village will feature a nursery where parents can leave their babies. France is also making accommodations for breastfeeding mothers.
summary: For the first time, the Olympic Village will feature a nursery where parents can leave their babies. France is also making accommodations for breastfeeding mothers.

title: Russia recruits sympathizers online for sabotage in Europe, officials say
content: Europe has been grappling with an increase in Moscow-led sabotage attacks as Russia turns its focus to increasing the cost of Western support for Ukraine.
summary: Europe has been grappling with an increase in Moscow-led sabotage attacks as Russia turns its focus to increasing the cost of Western support for Ukraine.

title: Russia orders arrest of Yulia Navalnaya, widow of Putin’s nemesis
content: Russia’s decision to issue an arrest warrant for Navalnaya on the same day India’s prime minister was visiting Moscow sent a loud message to Putin’s critics, including in Washington.
summary: Russia’s decision to issue an arrest warrant for Navalnaya on the same day India’s prime minister was visiting Moscow sent a loud message to Putin’s critics, including in Washington.

title: Cypress Hill brings 28-year-old ‘Simpsons’ joke to life with London orchestra
content: Decades later, a joke on “The Simpsons” will come true — with hip-hop group Cypress Hill performing with the London Symphony Orchestra for an “insane” show.
summary: Decades later, a joke on “The Simpsons” will come true — with hip-hop group Cypress Hill performing with the London Symphony Orchestra for an “insane” show.

title: As fears mount of an Israel-Lebanon war, Hezbollah’s arsenal looms large
content: The Lebanese militant group has guided and unguided rockets, antitank artillery, ballistic and anti-ship missiles, as well as drones equipped with explosives.
summary: The Lebanese militant group has guided and unguided rockets, antitank artillery, ballistic and anti-ship missiles, as well as drones equipped with explosives.

title: At NATO summit, Gaza is the elephant in the room
content: War rages in Ukraine and across the Middle East. But at this week’s NATO summit, it’s unlikely Gaza will draw much attention.
summary: War rages in Ukraine and across the Middle East. But at this week’s NATO summit, it’s unlikely Gaza will draw much attention.

title: U.S. to provide more air defenses after missile strike on Kyiv children’s hospital
content: Young patients were to be sent to Germany after a Russian missile strike on the Okhmatdyt children’s hospital, in which two people, including a doctor, were killed.
summary: Young patients were to be sent to Germany after a Russian missile strike on the Okhmatdyt children’s hospital, in which two people, including a doctor, were killed.

title: NATO vows lasting support for Ukraine but won’t promise membership
content: Admitting Ukraine into the alliance remains a contentious subject. Some NATO members fear absorbing a country mired in conflict with a nuclear superpower.
summary: Admitting Ukraine into the alliance remains a contentious subject. Some NATO members fear absorbing a country mired in conflict with a nuclear superpower.

title: Renewed Israeli offensive sees Gaza City health care crumble
content: Fighting in the north hinders hospitals, while an airstrike in central Gaza led to at least 17 deaths, according to local officials.
summary: Fighting in the north hinders hospitals, while an airstrike in central Gaza led to at least 17 deaths, according to local officials.

title: Why the French election result was such a surprise
content: Polling firms say their models weren’t able to fully capture the shifting dynamics in the days before the vote.
summary: Polling firms say their models weren’t able to fully capture the shifting dynamics in the days before the vote.

title: Modi bear-hugs Putin in Moscow, marking deep ties between Russia and India
content: The visit shows India will maintain close ties with Russia despite Washington’s efforts to woo Prime Minister Narendra Modi and isolate President Vladimir Putin.
summary: The visit shows India will maintain close ties with Russia despite Washington’s efforts to woo Prime Minister Narendra Modi and isolate President Vladimir Putin.

title: Fed up with tourists, Barcelona protesters blast them with water guns
content: Locals marched and delivered a manifesto on tourism’s cost-of-living impact, the latest backlash against a global travel surge since the end of pandemic limits.
summary: Locals marched and delivered a manifesto on tourism’s cost-of-living impact, the latest backlash against a global travel surge since the end of pandemic limits.

title: Another year of heat and floods spurs China’s climate-change awakening
content: Beijing has made adapting to extreme weather a policy priority, and weather officials issued an unusually direct warning about the intensifying heat and rainfall.
summary: Beijing has made adapting to extreme weather a policy priority, and weather officials issued an unusually direct warning about the intensifying heat and rainfall.

title: Russian missile attack kills 37 in Ukraine, hits children’s hospital
content: Among those killed in Monday’s attack were three children, said Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.
summary: Among those killed in Monday’s attack were three children, said Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: With Orban in China and Modi in Russia, Putin’s multipolar world takes shape
content: As Hungary’s leader pushed for a Ukraine cease-fire, Russian missile strikes hit a children’s hospital in Kyiv and killed at least 37 across the country.
summary: As Hungary’s leader pushed for a Ukraine cease-fire, Russian missile strikes hit a children’s hospital in Kyiv and killed at least 37 across the country.

title: Thousands flee as Israel launches new Gaza City operation
content: As talks continued to sputter, Israel’s military moved into Gaza City in the north of the Strip, prompting widespread civilian displacement.
summary: As talks continued to sputter, Israel’s military moved into Gaza City in the north of the Strip, prompting widespread civilian displacement.

title: Playwright and director sentenced to six years in prison by Russian court
content: Theater director Yevgenia Berkovich and playwright Svetlana Petriychuk were arrested in May 2023 and prosecuted behind closed doors in Moscow over a play they staged in 2020.
summary: Theater director Yevgenia Berkovich and playwright Svetlana Petriychuk were arrested in May 2023 and prosecuted behind closed doors in Moscow over a play they staged in 2020.
